ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: yes, i actually learn a lot
I would definitely recommend this class to other students, if fact I already have! depending on someone's goals and background I would recommend either taking it for credit or auditing it.

I highly recommend it, provided that one is able to put a lot of time into the homeworks. Most problem sets combined abstract problems and more hands-on problems involving data analysis and simulations. The latter, while very interesting in my opinion, do demand a lot of time for programming. I think the course description should include a prerequisite or warning about the coding skills required in Matlab or a similar language.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: i think it will help my research!

The subject matter was at the periphery of my discipline so I think it gave me a different perspective on my field and different ways to think about our systems. Also it gives you a way to critically evaluate arguments that derive from soft matter physics.

I learned a lot by taking the time to go through all the problem sets. I particularly enjoyed learning about simulation methods such a Monte Carlo, and I believe skills will be valuable in my research.
